review: I give the Fire TV Stick 4.5 stars so far but I'm certain my rating will change to 5 stars.  I just haven't owned the Fire Stick for long enough (or used it enough) to feel comfortable with a 5-star rating.  I was a little nervous at first with the setup (it took a minute for the television to acknowledge the correct HD port, turning the television off helped a lot) and then it took another minute to boot the Fire Stick.  Once those issues were overcome, set up was easy and intuitive.  The video guy was helpful, but a little corny.  Streaming is a little slow at times, but that has more to do with my wi-fi service/bandwith than with the Fire TV Stick.  When I'm home alone, and have the wi-fi all to myself, streaming is just fine!  My husband finds the remote to be a little small, but I didn't buy it for his big hands and the remote is fine for me!  I may tell him to download the app in order use his phone as the remote, (which I enjoy doing as well) but only after I've watched my programs.  Great job Amazon!  I can't wait to bump my rating up to 5 stars!
author: Amazon Customer

review: At first I wasn't sure if I would use this, but I bought one, Now I LOVE IT. Whenever I travel on vacation or business, I bring it and plug it in to the tv- bam - instant on demand (with my Netflix and Prime account) and no heavy hotel fees. I also use it instead of my DVR on my home tv because the remote control is easier to use than the cable tv one for video watching. For guest room, it is great because I have no cable box in there. This stick uses my wireless Internet to stream tv and movies from Netflix for the guest tv.
